title: Combined Effects of Time Spent in Physical Activity, Sedentary Behaviors and Sleep on Obesity and Cardio-Metabolic Health Markers: A Novel Compositional Data Analysis Approach.
Data Source: NHANES
NonWear_Criterion: NR
Sleep_Detection_Method: "How much sleep do you actually get at night on weekdays or workdays" as integer from 1 to 24 hours
Cutpoint_Type: Standard count per minutes thresholds (Freedson et al, 1998)
Closure_Method: Sleep (self-report) and accelerometer-derived SB, LIPA, MVPA expressed as proportions of 24 h and normalized so the sum = 1

title: Associations between sleep duration, sedentary time, physical activity, and health indicators among Canadian children and youth using compositional analyses.
Data Source: Canadian Health Measures Survey (CHMS) cycles 1 to 3
NonWear_Criterion: ³60 consecutive minutes of zero counts, with allowance for 2 min of counts between zero and 100
Sleep_Detection_Method: Self-reported (response to "How many hours do you (your child) usually spend sleeping in a 24-hour period, excluding time spent resting.")
Cutpoint_Type: Count per minutes thresholds (Colley et al. 2010)

title: Fitness, fatness and the reallocation of time between children's daily movement behaviours: an analysis of compositional data.
Data Source: Active Schools: Skelmersdale study
NonWear_Criterion: Standard deviation and value range of each accelerometer axis, calculated for moving windows of 60 min with 15 min increments
NonWear_Handling: Replaced by the mean value calculated from measurement on other days at the same time of day
Sleep_Detection_Method: van Hees algorithm (GGIR R package)

title: Fitness, fatness and the reallocation of time between children's daily movement behaviours: an analysis of compositional data.
Data Source: Active Schools: Skelmersdale study
NonWear_Criterion: Standard deviation and value range of each accelerometer axis, calculated for moving windows of 60 min with 15 min increments
NonWear_Handling: Replaced by the mean value calculated from measurement on other days at the same time of day
Sleep_Detection_Method: van Hees algorithm (GGIR R package)

title: Adiposity and the isotemporal substitution of physical activity, sedentary time and sleep among school-aged children: a compositional data analysis approach.
Data Source: International Study of Childhood Obesity, Lifestyle and the Environment (ISCOLE)
NonWear_Criterion: ³20 consecutive minutes of 0 activity counts
Sleep_Detection_Method: Fully automated algorithm (ActiLife software)

title: Human development index, children's health-related quality of life and movement behaviors: a compositional data analysis.
Data Source: International Study of Childhood Obesity, Lifestyle and the Environment (ISCOLE)
Country: Australia, Brazil, Canada, China, Colombia, England, Finland, India, Kenya, Portugal, South Africa, and the United States (12 nations)
NonWear_Criterion: NR
Sleep_Detection_Method: Barreira et al, 2014 Sleep detection Algorithm
Zero_Handling_Method: checked for zeros; none were present; thus no handling done
Transformation_Details: First ILR coordinate: Numerator = MVPA; Denominator = geometric mean of Sleep, SB, LPA
